What is Calm Harm for?

• 3. The App comprises the mobile software application accompanying this Agreement, including without limitation any software code, scripts, interfaces, graphics, displays, text, documentation and other components, and any updates, modifications or enhancements to them.

• 5. The information and tasks in the App are not, and are not intended to be a substitute for, professional medical or psychological advice, diagnosis or treatment that can be provided by your own medical provider or mental health provider. Commentary and other materials available via the App are not, and are not intended to amount to, medical advice on which reliance should be placed. Subject to paragraphs 7 to 9 below, we disclaim all liability and responsibility arising from any reliance placed on such materials by any user of the App, or by anyone who may be informed of any of its contents. You agree that you will not disregard or delay seeking professional, medical, mental health or other relevant professional advice in substitution of the App. Do not stop any treatment you are having as a result of this App without speaking to your own medical provider, mental health provider or qualified medical professional.

• 6. This App is intended for use by persons aged 12 or over. Persons under the age of 12 must access and use this App with parental supervision or under the care of a qualified mental health provider.

Information We Collect From You
• We will collect and process the following data about you:

• 4. Information you give us (âSubmitted informationâ). This is information you give us about you by filling in forms on the App Site and the Services Sites (together âOur Sitesâ), or by corresponding with us (for example, by e-mail or chat). It includes information you provide when you register to use the App Site, download or register the App, subscribe to any of our Services, search for the App or Service, enter a competition, promotion or survey and when you report a problem with the App, our Services, or any of our Sites. If you contact us, we will keep a record of that correspondence. The information you give us may include your age, username, password, gender, various feedback on the App and whether you currently receive medical care/advice for self-harm.
• 5. Information we collect about you and your device. Each time you visit one of our Sites or use the App we will automatically collect the following information:

1. 5.1. technical information, including the type of mobile device you use, your mobile operating system, the type of mobile browser you use and time zone setting (âDevice Informationâ); and
  2. 5.2. details of your use of any of our Apps or your visits to any of Our Sites including, but not limited to traffic data and other communication data (âLog Informationâ).

• 6. Unique application numbers. When you install or uninstall a Service containing a unique application number or when such a Service searches for automatic updates, that number and information about your installation, for example, the type of operating system, may be sent to us.
Uses Made Of The Information
• 7. We use information held about you in the following ways:

1. 7.1. Submitted Information: used for customisation of the App and our Sites to deliver tailored content. Submitted Information is also used for research purposes so that stem4 may understand about users of the App and overall self-harm trends;
  2. 7.2. Device information and Location Information: general insight relating to Google Analytics and functionality relating to the App (Older versions of Android may have reduced functionality);
  3. 7.3. Log information: general insight relating to Google Analytics and functionality relating to the App; and
  4. 7.4. Unique application numbers: insight and information relating to App updates and general insight relating to Google Analytics.
